result.execSummary:
Scott William Simpkins was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Scott William Simpkins was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Scott William Simpkins

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney J. D Thornton appeared TELEPHONICALLY.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

This is an extradition case.
Defendant is on his way to Louisiana custody.
State moves for this case to be administratively closed.
Court GRANTS State's motion and ORDERS this case "administratively closed".

Defendant Scott William Simpkins in court with attorney J. D Thornton.  Defendant Scott William Simpkins in custody.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of rights and right to file a Writ of Habeas Corpus.  Court found Defendant is the person wanted in the State of Louisiana.
Defendant waived extradition.  Court finds Defendant has freely and voluntarily agreed to return to the State of Louisiana.

Signed Waiver of Extradition received and filed.  Copy of the Waiver sent to the Office of the Governor, State Capitol.  Court ordered the Defendant remanded into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department. Case adjourned for a Status Conference in Branch 2.  Status conference scheduled for June 20, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney J. Dennis Thornton in court, defendant Scott William Simpkins not in court, in custody.  Timothy J Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties are awaiting the governor's warrant; MPD is actively seeking the governor's warrant at this time.
Statements made.
Case adjourned to 05-20-2014 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Status Conference.

Defendant Scott William Simpkins in court with attorney Daryl A. Kastenson.  Defendant Scott William Simpkins in custody.  Karine E. O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.    DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge DONALD, Branch 2.   Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of rights and right to file a Writ of Habeas Corpus.  Court found the defendant is the person wanted in the State of LOUISIANA.  Defendant contested extradition.  Court ordered Defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
  Status conference scheduled for April 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
